author: lpanchot
title: DAO smart contract templetizaiton
description: No hay una manera fácil de crear, gobernar y ejecutar protocolos DAO.

f6_assessments.q0: They address the problem of making DAO creation an easy affair. They ad value to the Cardano ecosystem by facilitating DAO creation, making it easy and attractive to new users.  The key metrics of the project are in line with the  Challenge setting's in the sense of user and DAO onboarding. They mention building a DAO around their infrastructure that allows token holders to submit and vote on proposals. Not sure if it involves protocol changes, but in order to scale well I think voting on protocol changes should be implemented.
f6_assessments.q1: They provided links to LinkedIn via website and the team doesn't include a Plutus developer. The Github link they shared isn't very active. You need to let the community know who your Plutus dev is in order to gain their trust.  The budget is broken down into 2 items. Audit smart contracts and pay team to develop smart contracts. What about frontend and backend development? You want to pay a team $30 000 to create smart contracts, but the community doesn't know who this Plutus dev team is. Version 1 will be launched Q3/4 2022 which is very reasonable for what is being built. They explain some parts of the project they will build. Mainly focused on the smart contracts. They don't go into any technical detail on how they are building these tools. Providing the technical details will show the reader your approach to the problem and could boost confidence in your skills. They haven't considered any risks or challenges. You need to show the reader that you are aware and prepared for future challenges and risks. Not being prepared could slow you down.
f6_assessments.q2: They have a 2 roadmaps, one with detailed paragraphs and one with items as milestones. Some milestones are measurable KPIs. I would ad more KPIs to make it easier to track performance of the project. They address the problem of insufficient tooling available for DAO creation and they solve this by creating "no code smart contract templates to facilitate DAO creation, governance, and execution".

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is feasible, providing DAO through API integration or inputting information on the user interface without programming knowledge. Read the proposal and whitepaper with very clear information on solutions and options. Smart contracts will be developed gradually, will be more complete when adding the limit of the proposal or specifying what content to serve. Proposal is challenging and scalable
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent provides full information in the whitepaper. Solutions and options are clearly described and easily understood through diagrams. Timeline clearly details built functions and Token issuance rate. Links, groups to interact with the project are also provided, it would be great to provide both the identities and professional skills of the members. The proposed amount will be clearer when the details of building the interface or API are added, how long it takes, whether the amount is enough to carry out the project or if there are other sources of funding.
f6_assessments.q2: In the whitepaper, I have not found any part about the reward when participating and holding the token, how to attract people to hold the Token, besides dividing the reward when the DAO is used, what other benefits are there. How can users trust your DAO, are there any challenges and risks when using it, it would be great for you to provide this information with a roadmap to handling

f6_assessments.q0: The Proposer wants to create a no code smart contract to make it easy to create, govern, and execute DAO protocols. The challenge is simple and clear and well understood.
f6_assessments.q1: The team of expert engineers who are capable of implementing the project successfully. The plan mentioned that the project would be carried out in two phases- technical and business development phases- which provide details in the proposal. The proposal is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map has 3, 6 and 12 months intervals of different phases of work. The budget breakdown is understandable. However KPIs are not clearly seen.

solution: Estamos creando plantillas de contratos inteligentes sin código para facilitar la creación, el gobierno y la ejecución de las DAO.
experience: Contamos con un equipo de ingenieros de gran talento y tenemos un producto beta listo para su lanzamiento a la espera de la integración de PAB. https://clearcontracts.io/team
